alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:33PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henderson, west central Warren, southeastern Henry, southern Des Moines and northeastern Lee Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1133 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Denmark, or 9 miles north of Fort Madison, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Middletown and Iowa Army Ammunition Plant around 1140 PM CDT. West Burlington around 1145 PM CDT. Burlington and Carman around 1150 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Gulf Port, Oquawka, Biggsville and Gladstone. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.
